alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany; Tangipahoa; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 24 at 7:10PM CST until January 24 at 8:45PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southern Tangipahoa Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Washington Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northwestern Pearl River County in southern Mississippi... Southeastern Walthall County in southern Mississippi... * Until 845 PM CST. * At 710 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain leading to flash flooding. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hammond, Bogalusa, Covington, Franklinton, Abita Springs, Varnado, Folsom, Sun, Enon, Crossroads, Dexter, Robert, Natalbany and Angie. This includes the follwing Interstate... Interstate 12 between mile markers 40 and 56. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
